channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: Today, Ashleigh, Lisa, Naesan and Andrew battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Top criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC re-examine the case against a young farm labourer convicted of the brutal murder of a travelling watch repairman in 1880. On a cold February morning in 1880, a travelling draper was walking along a country lane on the border of Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire when he spotted a hat on the ground. He stopped to pick it up and made a grisly discovery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The team travel up and down the county revisiting some of the historic venues from the series, plus new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin also takes a look through Bamburgh Castle's rich history and picks his top Kings of the Castle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Babatunde Al?sh?, Sophie Duker, Gaby Roslin and Jeff Stelling take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: As long as the water's warm, Clive loves to swim, so he's enthusiastic about taking a dip in the vast volcanic spring of Saturnia and discovering why Italians believe in the healing power of thermal water. Travelling on through Maremma - a big stretch of country running between Tuscany and Lazio - Clive stays in a treehouse at a lavender farm and learns how to extract oil from the plants.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Restaurateur Aoibheann MacNamara is embarking on an ambitious but sensitive restoration of an old Land Commission cottage in the middle of the protected environment of the Burren.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: Hidden away in the most easterly part of the British Isles are the Fens of East Anglia, a landscape of big skies and distant horizons, wild wetlands and fertile farmland. Water has always been the driving force here.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: As week two of Springwatch draws to a close, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are only scratching the surface with the wildlife highlights on offer at the Longshaw Estate. Iolo Williams is wrapping up his Rathlin Island adventure.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Marie-Antoinette
channel.desc: When Marie Antoinette gets implicated in the theft of the diamond necklace, she is determined to prove her innocence and punish those responsible. Marie Antoinette has Rohan publicly arrested and thrown in the Bastille.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: Featuring Tom Allen, Jess Fostekew and Mawaan Rizwan.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Detectorists
channel.desc: With time running out, Andy and Lance go to great lengths to protect their land. Away from the fields, life is no less stressful as Andy quits his job and Lance finds an unwelcome guest in the spare room. An audacious theft leaves Lance reeling.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Rise and Fall of Michelle Mone
channel.desc: The story of Michelle Mone's elevation to the House of Lords and the ongoing controversy around her links to a business which was awarded a PPE contract through the so-called 'VIP fast lane'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Iolo's River Valleys
channel.desc: Iolo Williams explores the Vale of Clwyd, from coastal lizards and rare butterflies to a tame raven and elusive red squirrels, uncovering the valley's hidden wonders and wildlife.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Power of Parker
channel.desc: Parker's are up for an award! Diane is a bag of nerves so Kath tags along for support. Martin swallows his pride and get a manual job. Nobody's night turns out as planned.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
channel.desc: At St John's Hospital in Livingston, consultant ear, nose and throat surgeon Ashley Hay specialises in some of the most challenging cancer cases: removing tumours from the head and neck. He's joining forces with consultant plastic surgeon Patrick Addison for a complex and unusual case. They're hoping to both save their patient's life and preserve her ability to smile.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Doctor Who
channel.desc: Battle rages across the skies as the Unholy Trinity unleash their deadly ambition. The Doctor, Belinda and Ruby have to risk everything in the quest to save one innocent life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Significant layout changes are in store for three properties in Merseyside, London and Rotherham. Will the new owners manage to transform their auction purchases on budget?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Flo and Lee are in Salford to transform Lottie and Mead's eyesore back yard into something cool and edgy that epitomises their urban lifestyle but also captures the heart of their Edwardian home.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Anna Haugh's Big Irish Food Tour
channel.desc: The Black Ball Final made Dennis Taylor a household name. At home in Tyrone, Anna recreates his grandmother's soda bread and they join fishermen to celebrate the Lough Neagh eel.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Ably assisted by Lila, an expert labrador, Michael Portillo hunts for truffles in the Istrian countryside near the hilltop town of Buzet. His railway adventure through the Balkan countries of Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
channel.desc: Nick Robinson has a conversation with, not an interrogation of, the people who shape our political thinking about what shaped theirs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Edge
channel.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lightning
channel.desc: Comedian Zoe Lyons presents the electrifyingly fast quiz with a ?3,000 jackpot. Six plucky contestants compete across six rounds testing their general knowledge, quick thinking and speedy reactions whilst our ruthless spotlight patrols the studio.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: Today, Graham, Julie, Cheryl and Khush battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Top criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC re-examine the complex case against a Victorian auctioneer accused, alongside his brother and two others, of murdering his wife. Penge, 1877.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Revisiting locations from the series, including the Ulster Folk and Transport Museum, Croombe in south Worcestershire and Crowcombe Court in Somerset. There are some items to take to auction, and Paul Martin discovers a hidden pocket of Cornwall.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Babatunde Al?sh?, Sophie Duker, Gaby Roslin and Jeff Stelling take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: Clive takes on the star goal scorer for ACF Fiorentina's women's team in a penalty shoot-out. Back in the city, he indulges his passion for fashion - his mum Lynne was a seamstress for Burberry, and his first job was on Black Beauty and Hair magazine - by getting a masterclass in Italian menswear. Clive also discovers why italics are so Italian as he designs a wedding card for his niece Lucy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: Paul discovers the source of the remarkable River Nith, high in a remote forestry plantation. Heading downstream, he hears the story of the Knockshinnoch mining disaster, how 116 men were saved from entombment after a massive earth collapse.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: With the arrival of June, Beechgrove enters a time of colour, scent and productivity. Lizzie Schofield explores these features as she revisits the herb garden.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is busy in the cottage garden. As the roses begin to bloom, he inserts underplanting. Adam Frost goes to a walled garden. Nick Bailey's aims to inspire everyone to transform outdoor spaces. A man turns a barren plot into a wonderful haven.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: The battle to save the homes and treasures left by two Royalist women who refused to submit during the English Civil War - Ham House and Corfe Castle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Inside No. 9
channel.desc: There's a new couple at No 9. The residents of Mulberry Close are keen to welcome their new neighbours, but there's something about Damon and Val that doesn't seem quite right.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: International T20 Cricket
channel.desc: Highlights of the first game of the T20 series between England and the West Indies.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: All Is True
channel.desc: The year is 1613, and Shakespeare is acknowledged as the greatest writer of the age. But disaster strikes when his renowned Globe Theatre burns to the ground. Devastated, Shakespeare returns to Stratford, where he must face a troubled past and a neglected family. Haunted by the death of his only son, Hamnet, he struggles to mend the broken relationship with his wife and daughters. In so doing, he is ruthlessly forced to examine his own failings as a husband and father.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: Ros Atkins sets out to discover the truth about how our money is spent and why politicians keep running into trouble when they try to cut spending.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
channel.desc: Much to Trevor's irritation, a rare phoenix woodpecker takes a liking to him. He demands an immediate quest to return the bird to its real home.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: The Lemmings have fun destroying ice towers. When Grizzy sees them, it inspires him to sculpt statues of himself, but the Lemmings cannot resist the temptation to destroy the statues of Grizzy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: A container adrift along the icefield changes the lives of Grizzy and the Lemmings.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pok?mon Horizons: The Series
channel.desc: Liko and the others arrive in Medali, where they eat dinner at a struggling eatery. The eatery's mascot Pok?mon Kingambit does not seem to be doing a good job attracting guests either.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: A prickly guest turns up at Joe and Adam's house and needs a lot of care, but Callum hasn't made it easy for them.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Operation Ouch!
channel.desc: The doctors become their favourite virus, and we take off with the Flying Doctors.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Peter
channel.desc: Shini meets a `Blue Peter' fan who balances school with life as a farmer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is busy in the cottage garden. As the roses begin to bloom, he inserts underplanting. Adam Frost goes to a walled garden. Nick Bailey's aims to inspire everyone to transform outdoor spaces. A man turns a barren plot into a wonderful haven.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tommy Steele Story
channel.desc: A rags-to-riches tale of a young merchant seaman called Tommy who discovers a certain way with the guitar.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Women's Challenge Cup
channel.desc: Tanya Arnold presents live coverage as St Helens and Wigan Warriors do battle for the Women's Challenge Cup at Wembley Stadium. The Wigan-Saints rivalry is one of the most famous in rugby league, but this will be the first time the women's teams have met in a major final. Saints have been the dominant force in an ever-expanding women's game and are aiming to lift the trophy for the fifth consecutive time. However, Wigan are emerging as real contenders.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: I Know Where I'm Going!
channel.desc: A headstrong girl who intends to marry for money is rescued from her mercenary course of action when she is stranded in a Scottish coastal town for a week. Gradually her heartless ambition to marry a multi-millionaire fades and she falls in love with a young naval officer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: David Attenborough tells the story behind the world's most famous meerkat family, part of the longest running animal behaviour study ever. For meerkats Squirt and Weeny, the study means little, as they are facing up to the challenge of a drought.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich. Antique expert Philip Serrell discovers a postcard signed by Malcolm Campbell showing him in his boat Bluebird, and Jonathan Pratt gets excited over a collection of fans.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: The battle to save the homes and treasures left by two Royalist women who refused to submit during the English Civil War - Ham House and Corfe Castle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jane Austen: Rise of a Genius
channel.desc: At 27, Jane Austen stands at a crossroads. After the loss of her father throws the family into turmoil, Jane publishes two successful novels, `Sense and Sensibility' and `Pride and Prejudice'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Scandinavia with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: On the last leg of his Scandinavian journey, Simon uncovers the surprising and sometimes shocking side of Sweden and Denmark, two of the happiest and wealthiest countries on earth.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Dad's Army
channel.desc: Mainwaring's motley crew are put in charge of a vital telephone line, but get distracted by a bomb hanging from a telephone cable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Billy Joel at the BBC
channel.desc: With songs like Uptown Girl, Piano Man and We Didn't Start the Fire, Billy Joel was one of the most successful artists of the 1970s and 80s. This deep dive into his appearances over the decades on the BBC digs up the best moments from the archives, with all the biggest hits and fan favourites from his first UK hit, Just the Way You Are, through to the last big single of his career, The River of Dreams.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Billy Joel: The 100th -- Live at Madison Square Garden
channel.desc: Billy Joel's record-breaking 100th consecutive performance at Madison Square Garden.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
channel.desc: From 1978, Billy Joel performs songs from his album `The Stranger', including, `Movin' Out (Anthony's Song)', `Just the Way You Are' and `Only the Good Die Young'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Purple Rain
channel.desc: The Kid comes from a broken Minneapolis home but his talent for music and charisma put him on the road to stardom. This film is a semi-autobiographical account of the rock star formerly known as Prince.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Bombing of Pan Am 103
channel.desc: The ongoing joint Scottish and FBI investigation closes in on the identity of the 'mystery shopper'. Together, the teams work to uncover the co-conspirators behind the Lockerbie bomb plot. Vital progress is threatened by troubled relations between international agencies. A secret CIA asset could hold the key to revealing the identities of those responsible for the bombing of Pan Am 103.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Bombing of Pan Am 103
channel.desc: Over a decade after the Lockerbie bombing, following much debate and international negotiation, the accused will finally stand trial. The venue will be a purpose-built Scottish court in the Netherlands. Bereaved relatives around the world campaign for access to the trial. Scottish police and the FBI continue to work tirelessly to secure vital witness testimony and deliver meticulously collected forensic evidence. Will the investigators finally secure justice for the victims and their families?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: With the arrival of June, Beechgrove enters a time of colour, scent and productivity. Lizzie Schofield explores these features as she revisits the herb garden.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Weatherman Derek Brockway walks from Ynyslas to Aberystwyth, Cardigan Bay. He explores one of Britain's largest and oldest raised peat bogs, and his route then takes him to a unique railway museum, filled with nostalgia.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Landward
channel.desc: Dougie is in Skye to find out how crofters are providing a summer home for corncrakes. Meanwhile, Shahbaz sails to Ailsa Craig to see how conservationists are protecting the island's seabird colony.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Farming Life
channel.desc: It's January and the new year brings with it wild weather. On the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides on the edge of the Atlantic, ex-barrister-turned-crofter Sandy Granville is surveying the damage to his croft after one of the worst storms on record.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Beautiful Fantastic
channel.desc: When Bella Brown, a reclusive young woman is threatened with eviction unless she gives her garden a makeover, she sets to work watched by her scornful and curmudgeonly next-door neighbour, Alfie.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Julius Caesar
channel.desc: Twenty three senators of Rome's Republic, including Brutus and Cassius, murder Caesar to prevent his supposed aspirations as King of Rome. They go unpunished until Caesar's former legate, Mark Antony, speaks against them. The conspirators are forced to flee to the East, where they form an army. Antony raises his own army to fight them.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rome's Invisible City
channel.desc: Alexander Armstrong, with the help of a team of experts using the latest in 3D scanning technology, explores the hidden underground treasures that made Rome the powerhouse of the ancient world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: Clive swerves Tuscany's famous posh villas to head to the mediaeval town of Barga, where over half the locals have Scottish connections. Staying in a mansion that's now a Glaswegian-run B&B, Clive finds out why Italians love a fish supper, finds himself cooking dinner for 14, and joins an expedition to discover the forgotten quartz quarry that helped make Tuscany's capital Florence so beautiful.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: In the penultimate episode, the finish line is in sight for the four remaining teams, who need to reach the seventh checkpoint - Panaji, the tiny capital of India's smallest state, Goa.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
channel.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder visit Italy to go behind the scenes at Borgo Egnazia, a hotel modelled on Puglia's historical local villages. Monica makes foccaccia for a festival, while Rob meets the exceptional decorating team.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain with distinctly mixed results.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Imagine...
channel.desc: At the age of 91 Mel Brooks is unstoppable. With his musical `Young Frankenstein' opening to great critical acclaim in London late in 2017, Alan Yentob visits Mel at home in Hollywood, at work and at play. With the aid of BBC archives stretching back decades, together they embark on an unpredictable, irresistible journey through the city of stars, meeting the legendary Carl Reiner along the way.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Imagine...
channel.desc: To mark David Bowie's comeback album and a new exhibition, Alan Yentob looks back at his legendary 1975 documentary, Cracked Actor. The film follows Bowie during the Diamond Dogs tour of 1974. The film has become one of the classic rock documentaries of all time, remaining an enduring influence on generations of Bowie fans.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Salman Rushdie: Through a Glass Darkly
channel.desc: In 2022, Sir Salman Rushdie was on a stage in Chautauqua, Pennsylvania, when a man emerged from the audience and subjected Rushdie to a 27-second knife attack. In an interview with Alan Yentob, Rushdie talks about the attack's devastating effects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Imagine...
channel.desc: To celebrate the life of editor and author Diana Athill, who has died at the age at 101, another opportunity to see an Imagine documentary first broadcast in 2010. At the age of 92 Diana Athill was suddenly a celebrity. Her frank and entertaining memoirs, mainly written after the age at which most people retire, charted a life less ordinary.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Imagine...
channel.desc: Playwright Tom Stoppard tells Alan Yentob the extraordinary story of his life and his latest play, `Leopoldstadt', in which he faces up to the pain and loss in his past.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Ella Fitzgerald at Ronnie Scott's
channel.desc: Recorded at Ronnie Scott's in London in 1974 and backed by the Tommy Flanagan Quartet, Ella Fitzgerald performs some of her most famous songs, including George Gershwin's `The Man I Love'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Ella Fitzgerald's Other Show
channel.desc: Ella Fitzgerald in performance at Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club in 1974.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Question Time
channel.desc: Features a studio audience quizzing top politicians on the events of the day. The panel surrounding presenter Fiona Bruce is composed of at least one member of the three major parties.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: The teams are trying to bag the bargains at an antiques centre in Long Marston, Warwickshire. David Harper's reds push for that extra pound discount, while Danny Sebastian's blues lose track of the time! Christina Trevanion heads to nearby Uttoxeter.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Chris and Charlie are in Swindon to transform retired rocker Ann's concrete and weed-ridden garden into a low-maintenance space with nature at its heart. The garden would be somewhere to relax and host friends and family.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan continue the 20th anniversary celebrations at the National Trust's Longshaw Estate in the Peak District. They launch a medley of new nests, and like any good soap opera, the drama has already begun.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from Queen's, where a stellar line-up has gathered to take part in the first women's event at the famous venue for more than half a century. The field includes reigning Wimbledon champion Barbora Krejcikova, along with former winners Petra Kvitova and Elena Rybakina, and four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka. Home hopes are headed by 2021 US Open champion Emma Raducanu and British number one Katie Boulter. Presented by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: International Friendly Football
channel.desc: Coverage from the latest fixture as preparations continue ahead of the next competitive match.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Previous players Michael Buerk, Kate Humble, Glenn Moore and Thanyia Moore take on a series of quiz rounds. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: As Springwatch heads into week three, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have all the weekend drama from the wildlife cameras at the Longshaw Estate. Iolo Williams lands in Mount Stewart, the final stop of his Northern Irish road trip, where he hopes to catch a glimpse of the elusive pine marten and red squirrels that roam the site. There's also an eye-opening film about peregrine crime in the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jane Austen: Rise of a Genius
channel.desc: Determined to secure her financial future, Austen dives back into her writing.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Upstart Crow
channel.desc: Will is thrilled with his new play, in which a bright and strong-minded young woman is crushed and humiliated into submission by a man, but it doesn't go down well with any of the women in his life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.
